intro: Amphicosmia laevis, commonly known as the smooth amphicosmia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
